dl.dd: Serializable, Cloneable
Calendar, GregorianCalendar, TimeZone, Serialized Form

li.div: Constant for a mode of start or end time specified as wall clock time. Wall clock time is standard time for the onset rule, and daylight time for the end rule.
Constant for a mode of start or end time specified as standard time.
Constant for a mode of start or end time specified as UTC. European Union rules are specified as UTC time, for example.
Constructs a SimpleTimeZone with the given base time zone offset from GMT and time zone ID with no daylight saving time schedule.

dl.dd: rawOffset - The base time zone offset in milliseconds to GMT.
ID - The time zone name that is given to this instance.

li.pre: public SimpleTimeZone(int rawOffset, String ID, int startMonth, int startDay, int startDayOfWeek, int startTime, int endMonth, int endDay, int endDayOfWeek, int endTime)
li.div: Constructs a SimpleTimeZone with the given base time zone offset from GMT, time zone ID, and rules for starting and ending the daylight time. Both startTime and endTime are specified to be represented in the wall clock time. The amount of daylight saving is assumed to be 3600000 milliseconds (i.e., one hour). This constructor is equivalent to: SimpleTimeZone(rawOffset, ID, startMonth, startDay, startDayOfWeek, startTime, SimpleTimeZone.WALL_TIME, endMonth, endDay, endDayOfWeek, endTime, SimpleTimeZone.WALL_TIME, 3600000)

dl.dd: rawOffset - The given base time zone offset from GMT.
ID - The time zone ID which is given to this object.
startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time starting day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in local wall clock time (in milliseconds within the day), which is local standard time in this case.
endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time ending day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in local wall clock time, (in milliseconds within the day) which is local daylight time in this case.
IllegalArgumentException - if the month, day, dayOfWeek, or time parameters are out of range for the start or end rule

li.pre: public SimpleTimeZone(int rawOffset, String ID, int startMonth, int startDay, int startDayOfWeek, int startTime, int endMonth, int endDay, int endDayOfWeek, int endTime, int dstSavings)
li.div: Constructs a SimpleTimeZone with the given base time zone offset from GMT, time zone ID, and rules for starting and ending the daylight time. Both startTime and endTime are assumed to be represented in the wall clock time. This constructor is equivalent to: SimpleTimeZone(rawOffset, ID, startMonth, startDay, startDayOfWeek, startTime, SimpleTimeZone.WALL_TIME, endMonth, endDay, endDayOfWeek, endTime, SimpleTimeZone.WALL_TIME, dstSavings)

dl.dd: rawOffset - The given base time zone offset from GMT.
ID - The time zone ID which is given to this object.
startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time starting day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in local wall clock time, which is local standard time in this case.
endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time ending day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in local wall clock time, which is local daylight time in this case.
dstSavings - The amount of time in milliseconds saved during daylight saving time.
IllegalArgumentException - if the month, day, dayOfWeek, or time parameters are out of range for the start or end rule

li.pre: public SimpleTimeZone(int rawOffset, String ID, int startMonth, int startDay, int startDayOfWeek, int startTime, int startTimeMode, int endMonth, int endDay, int endDayOfWeek, int endTime, int endTimeMode, int dstSavings)
li.div: Constructs a SimpleTimeZone with the given base time zone offset from GMT, time zone ID, and rules for starting and ending the daylight time. This constructor takes the full set of the start and end rules parameters, including modes of startTime and endTime. The mode specifies either wall time or standard time or UTC time .

dl.dd: rawOffset - The given base time zone offset from GMT.
ID - The time zone ID which is given to this object.
startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time starting day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in the time mode specified by startTimeMode.
startTimeMode - The mode of the start time specified by startTime.
endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time ending day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in time time mode specified by endTimeMode.
endTimeMode - The mode of the end time specified by endTime
dstSavings - The amount of time in milliseconds saved during daylight saving time.
IllegalArgumentException - if the month, day, dayOfWeek, time more, or time parameters are out of range for the start or end rule, or if a time mode value is invalid.
WALL_TIME, STANDARD_TIME, UTC_TIME

li.div: Sets the daylight saving time starting year.

dl.dd: year - The daylight saving starting year.

li.pre: public void setStartRule(int startMonth, int startDay, int startDayOfWeek, int startTime)
li.div: Sets the daylight saving time start rule. For example, if daylight saving time starts on the first Sunday in April at 2 am in local wall clock time, you can set the start rule by calling:setStartRule(Calendar.APRIL, 1, Calendar.SUNDAY, 2*60*60*1000);

dl.dd: startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time starting day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in local wall clock time, which is local standard time in this case.
IllegalArgumentException - if the startMonth, startDay, startDayOfWeek, or startTime parameters are out of range

li.div: Sets the daylight saving time start rule to a fixed date within a month. This method is equivalent to:setStartRule(startMonth, startDay, 0, startTime)

dl.dd: startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in local wall clock time, which is local standard time in this case. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
IllegalArgumentException - if the startMonth, startDayOfMonth, or startTime parameters are out of range

li.pre: public void setStartRule(int startMonth, int startDay, int startDayOfWeek, int startTime, boolean after)
li.div: Sets the daylight saving time start rule to a weekday before or after the given date within a month, e.g., the first Monday on or after the 8th.

dl.dd: startMonth - The daylight saving time starting month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 0 for January).
startDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time starts.
startDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time starting day-of-week.
startTime - The daylight saving time starting time in local wall clock time, which is local standard time in this case.
after - If true, this rule selects the first dayOfWeek on or afterdayOfMonth. If false, this rule selects the last dayOfWeek on or beforedayOfMonth.
IllegalArgumentException - if the startMonth, startDay, startDayOfWeek, or startTime parameters are out of range

li.pre: public void setEndRule(int endMonth, int endDay, int endDayOfWeek, int endTime)
li.div: Sets the daylight saving time end rule. For example, if daylight saving time ends on the last Sunday in October at 2 am in wall clock time, you can set the end rule by calling: setEndRule(Calendar.OCTOBER, -1, Calendar.SUNDAY, 2*60*60*1000);

dl.dd: endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time ending day-of-week. See the class description for the special cases of this parameter.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in local wall clock time, (in milliseconds within the day) which is local daylight time in this case.
IllegalArgumentException - if the endMonth, endDay, endDayOfWeek, or endTime parameters are out of range

li.div: Sets the daylight saving time end rule to a fixed date within a month. This method is equivalent to:setEndRule(endMonth, endDay, 0, endTime)

dl.dd: endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in local wall clock time, (in milliseconds within the day) which is local daylight time in this case.
IllegalArgumentException - the endMonth, endDay, or endTime parameters are out of range

li.pre: public void setEndRule(int endMonth, int endDay, int endDayOfWeek, int endTime, boolean after)
li.div: Sets the daylight saving time end rule to a weekday before or after the given date within a month, e.g., the first Monday on or after the 8th.

dl.dd: endMonth - The daylight saving time ending month. Month is a MONTH field value (0-based. e.g., 9 for October).
endDay - The day of the month on which the daylight saving time ends.
endDayOfWeek - The daylight saving time ending day-of-week.
endTime - The daylight saving ending time in local wall clock time, (in milliseconds within the day) which is local daylight time in this case.
after - If true, this rule selects the first endDayOfWeek on or afterendDay. If false, this rule selects the last endDayOfWeek on or before endDay of the month.
IllegalArgumentException - the endMonth, endDay, endDayOfWeek, or endTime parameters are out of range

li.div: Returns the offset of this time zone from UTC at the given time. If daylight saving time is in effect at the given time, the offset value is adjusted with the amount of daylight saving.

dl.dd: getOffset in class TimeZone
date - the time at which the time zone offset is found
the amount of time in milliseconds to add to UTC to get local time.
Calendar.ZONE_OFFSET, Calendar.DST_OFFSET

li.pre: public int getOffset(int era, int year, int month, int day, int dayOfWeek, int millis)
li.div:
Returns the difference in milliseconds between local time and UTC, taking into account both the raw offset and the effect of daylight saving, for the specified date and time. This method assumes that the start and end month are distinct. It also uses a default GregorianCalendar object as its underlying calendar, such as for determining leap years. Do not use the result of this method with a calendar other than a default GregorianCalendar.
Note: In general, clients should use Calendar.get(ZONE_OFFSET) + Calendar.get(DST_OFFSET) instead of calling this method.

dl.dd: getOffset in class TimeZone
era - The era of the given date.
year - The year in the given date.
month - The month in the given date. Month is 0-based. e.g., 0 for January.
day - The day-in-month of the given date.
dayOfWeek - The day-of-week of the given date.
millis - The milliseconds in day in standard local time.
The milliseconds to add to UTC to get local time.
IllegalArgumentException - the era, month, day, dayOfWeek, or millis parameters are out of range
Calendar.ZONE_OFFSET, Calendar.DST_OFFSET

li.div: Gets the GMT offset for this time zone.

dl.dd: getRawOffset in class TimeZone
the GMT offset value in milliseconds

li.div: Sets the base time zone offset to GMT. This is the offset to add to UTC to get local time.

dl.dd: setRawOffset in class TimeZone
offsetMillis - the given base time zone offset to GMT.

li.div: Sets the amount of time in milliseconds that the clock is advanced during daylight saving time.

dl.dd: millisSavedDuringDST - the number of milliseconds the time is advanced with respect to standard time when the daylight saving time rules are in effect. A positive number, typically one hour (3600000).

li.div: Returns the amount of time in milliseconds that the clock is advanced during daylight saving time.

dl.dd: getDSTSavings in class TimeZone
the number of milliseconds the time is advanced with respect to standard time when the daylight saving rules are in effect, or 0 (zero) if this time zone doesn't observe daylight saving time.

li.div: Queries if this time zone uses daylight saving time.

dl.dd: useDaylightTime in class TimeZone
true if this time zone uses daylight saving time; false otherwise.
TimeZone.inDaylightTime(Date), Calendar.DST_OFFSET

li.div: Returns true if this SimpleTimeZone observes Daylight Saving Time. This method is equivalent to useDaylightTime().

dl.dd: observesDaylightTime in class TimeZone
true if this SimpleTimeZone observes Daylight Saving Time; false otherwise.
TimeZone.useDaylightTime(), TimeZone.inDaylightTime(Date), Calendar.DST_OFFSET

li.div: Queries if the given date is in daylight saving time.

dl.dd: inDaylightTime in class TimeZone
date - the given Date.
true if daylight saving time is in effective at the given date; false otherwise.

li.div: Returns a clone of this SimpleTimeZone instance.

dl.dd: clone in class TimeZone
a clone of this instance.

li.div: Generates the hash code for the SimpleDateFormat object.

the hash code for this object
Object.equals(java.lang.Object), System.identityHashCode(java.lang.Object)

li.div: Compares the equality of two SimpleTimeZone objects.

dl.dd: equals in class Object
obj - The SimpleTimeZone object to be compared with.
True if the given obj is the same as this SimpleTimeZone object; false otherwise.
Object.hashCode(), HashMap

li.div: Returns true if this zone has the same rules and offset as another zone.

dl.dd: hasSameRules in class TimeZone
other - the TimeZone object to be compared with
true if the given zone is a SimpleTimeZone and has the same rules and offset as this one

li.div: Returns a string representation of this time zone.

dl.dd: toString in class Object
a string representation of this time zone.
